description: This creamy spinach dal is packed with vibrant spices and bursting with flavor. The best part: it cooks up in one pot and is easy enough for a weeknight dinner!
name: Spinach Dal
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons canola oil, (or high-heat oil of choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the bottom of a medium pot with oil and place it over medium heat.
When the oil is hot, add the onion and sauté for 5 minutes, until soft and translucent.
Add the garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, and mustard seeds to the pot. Sauté for about 1 minute more, until the garlic is very fragrant and the cumin seeds begin to darken.
Stir in the broth, pigeon peas, turmeric, ground cumin, garam masala, and cayenne pepper. Raise the heat and bring the liquid to a simmer.
Lower the heat and simmer, uncovered, until the pigeon peas are tender, about 40 minutes.
Stir in the spinach, a handful at a time, allowing each addition to cook down a bit before adding another handful.
Allow the spinach to simmer until fully wilted, about 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with basmati rice and fresh cilantro.
